data.event: The town was laid out in 1884 by George Washington Brewster who had homesteaded the land there.

event.title: was named the county seat in 1887

data.event: The community was named the county seat in 1887 after George Washington Brewster offered to build the required buildings.
In 1887 the outlaw D.C."Doc" Middleton opened a saloon in the community.
Following the 2010 census Brewster became the smallest incorporated county seat in the United States replacing Amidon, North Dakota for the title.
